Anyhow, your library path is not right.

Here are the steps I did to run the AddressBook example standalone.
sh-2.05b$ mkdir /tmp/PR29509
sh-2.05b$ cp /home/felipe/eclipse-motif/eclipse/libXm.so* /tmp/PR29509/
sh-2.05b$ cd /tmp/PR29509/
sh-2.05b$ export PATH=$PATH:/home/felipe/IBMJava2-131/jre/bin/
sh-2.05b$ export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/tmp/PR29509/
sh-2.05b$ export LANG=ja_JP.eucJP
[From eclipse: export the project org.eclipse.swt as /tmp/PR29509/swt.jar]
[From eclipse: export the libraries in org.eclipse.set.motif/os/linux/x86 
to /tmp/PR29509]
[From eclipse: export the project org.eclipse.swt.examples 
as /tmp/PR29509/swtexamples.jar]
sh-2.05b$ java -cp swt.jar:swtexamples.jar 
org.eclipse.swt.examples.addressbook.AddressBook

This works fine on DBCS locale, I was able to enter japanese input in the 
example, no problem.

(The way you are exporting the code and the libraries can be different than the 
way I did).

The best tip a can give you is:
1 - Instead of using -Djava.libray.path you could try setting the environment 
variable LD_LIBRARY_PATH.
2 - The LD_LIBRARY_PATH has to point to the place where the swt and motif 
libraries are. Im my case I copy them all to the same dir and point 
LD_LIBRARY_PATH to this place.
That's the content of directory I used:
sh-2.05b$ ls
libXm.so    libXm.so.2.1                libswt-kde-motif-2124.so  swt.jar
libXm.so.2  libswt-gnome-motif-2124.so  libswt-motif-2124.so      
swtexamples.jar

Hope this help.
